meanings.sent1: I will enter the room quietly.
meanings.sent2: Please enter your name in the guestbook.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken enter the house? To avoid the rain!
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the colors entered the sky like a painting.
meanings.sent5: The detective asked the suspect to enter the crime scene to recreate the events.

meanings.sent1: She will enter the club next week.
meanings.sent2: You need to enter the team to play in the tournament.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to enter the exclusive cat club but was denied entry.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the cause entered him into the ranks of the most respected members.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to enter the group with a positive attitude.

meanings.definition: To begin to be involved in.
meanings.sent1: He decided to enter the conversation after listening for a while.
meanings.sent2: It's important to enter the discussion with an open mind.
meanings.sent3: The clown accidentally entered the serious meeting and caused a burst of laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music entered her into the world of composing beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent5: The new employee was eager to enter the project and contribute fresh ideas.
